body_html:
@benoitsteiner Yes, I compile r0.11 with cuda 8, and my system is x86_64 with Tesla P100. And I just follow the guideline step by step to build TF.

To build with GPU support:

$ bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

$ bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg

The name of the .whl file will depend on your platform.

$ sudo pip install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-0.11.0rc0-py2-none-any.whl

Any special options need be given while compiling TF to support fp16?

body:
@benoitsteiner Yes, I compile r0.11 with cuda 8, and my system is x86_64 with Tesla P100. And I just follow the guideline step by step to build TF. 

# To build with GPU support:

$ bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

$ bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg

# The name of the .whl file will depend on your platform.

$ sudo pip install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-0.11.0rc0-py2-none-any.whl

Any special options need be given while compiling TF to support fp16?
